pull.title: gui, refactor: Register Qt meta types in application constructor
pull.body: Removes a warning when running `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=cocoa src/qt/test/test_bitcoin-qt`.

events.body: Pushed in #17457, then #19033, and now on it's own PR.

We could share those registrations with the main GUI code as also commented [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19011/files#r429144851). Since its test only,... not really necessary but would prevent further testing issues.

utACK 41c3af9fecd52d44fb205edec7c0f054036d41eb

@jonasschnelli yes, was already suggested by @ryanofsky somewhere and I've suggested adding `GUIUtils::registerMetaTypes`.

Ah just saw you linked the suggestion comment.

Moving to `GUIUtil::registerMetaTypes`, and because of `WalletModel*` registration, I need to `#include <qt/walletmodel.h>` which causes
```
A new circular dependency in the form of "qt/guiutil -> qt/walletmodel -> qt/guiutil" appears to have been introduced.
A new circular dependency in the form of "qt/clientmodel -> qt/guiutil -> qt/walletmodel -> qt/clientmodel" appears to have been introduced.
A new circular dependency in the form of "qt/guiutil -> qt/walletmodel -> qt/optionsmodel -> qt/guiutil" appears to have been introduced.
A new circular dependency in the form of "qt/guiutil -> qt/walletmodel -> qt/paymentserver -> qt/guiutil" appears to have been introduced.
```

re: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19104#issuecomment-635897334

Slight preference for just adding a new file like src/qt/types.h or src/qt/util_types.h to adding new circular dependencies here
How about `BitcoinApplication::registerMetaTypes` - maybe called from constructor?

> How about `BitcoinApplication::registerMetaTypes` - maybe called from constructor?

Seems good

rename.from: gui, test: Fix Cannot queue arguments of type size_t
rename.to: gui, refactor: Register Qt meta types in application constructor

events.body: Tested 9df2528e57ff3c22f3d5777eb6a60a326c909995 on macOS 10.15.5 -- works as expected.

events.message: gui, refactor: Register Qt meta types in application constructor

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #19011 (Reduce cs_main lock accumulation during GUI startup by jonasschnelli)
* #18817 (doc: Document differences in bitcoind and bitcoin-qt locale handling by practicalswift)
* #18604 (Display command line usage to console without requiring X Windows by rebroad)
* #17877 (qt, refactor: Make enums in BitcoinUnits class scoped by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Why a member function?
Could it be a non-member function, either in unnamed namespace or `static`?
